page.title: 02News from the area July 1985
page.content: The harvest and haymaking is going very well at the moment, and the short dry spell has helped a lot. On the motorway heavy traffic has been reported at the holiday weekends with over two thousand cars an hour being reported travelling southward on July 20th 1985. Heavy rain caused a number of small accidents but most people were travelling quite sensibly. Crops in the area have now taken a terrible battering from the atrocious weather and farmers are now having great difficulty in cutting the later corn and wheat.
